abstract: Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta says that United States will remain a Pacific power, despite hundreds of billions of dollars in expected cuts to the Pentagon budget, even as China expands its military presence in the region.
snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta tried to reassure countries concerned about China’s assertiveness that the United States would remain “a Pacific power.”

lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta tried to reassure countries concerned about China’s assertiveness that the United States would remain “a Pacific power.”

headline.main: U.S. to Sustain Military Power in the Pacific, Panetta Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Sustain Military Power In the Pacific, Panetta Says
headline.seo: Panetta Tells Pacific Countries That U.S. Will Keep Strong Presence
